MercyCorp demand table¶

MercyCorp location table¶

The aim of this module is to prepare the location table.

Created on Thu Jun 18 09:16:40 2020

@author: ioanna.papachristou@accenture.com

class my_package.location_table.LocationTable(path)¶

This class creates the location table.

concat_sub_tables()¶

Concatenates the list of geodataframes into a single geodataframe. :return: A geodataframe of all hierarchies containing only the necessary columns.

export_to_parquet(gdf, file_name)¶

Exports a geodataframe to a parquet format. :param gdf: The geodataframe to be exported :param file_name: the name of the file to be exported

MercyCorp utils flat files¶

The aim of this module is to to list useful functions related to flat files.

@author: ioanna.papachristou@accenture.com

class my_package.utils_flat_files.FlatFiles(path_in='data/input/', path_out='data/output/')¶

Functions to treat flat files.

add_date_id(df, column)¶
Parameters

  • df – The dataframe that includes the column to be transform to datetime

  • column – The column to be transform to datetime

Returns

The initial dataframe adding the dateID column

export_csv_w_date(df, file_name)¶
Parameters

  • df – The dataframe to be exported.

  • file_name – The name of the file we want to export to.

Returns

Exports both to parquet and csv formats including today’s date in the name.

Parameters

  • df – The dataframe to be exported.

  • file_name – The name of the file we want to export to.

Returns

Exports both to parquet and csv formats

  • file_name – The name of the file we want to export to.

Returns

Exports both to parquet and csv formats including today’s date in the name.

Parameters

  • df – The dataframe to be exported.

  • file_name – The name of the file we want to export to.

Exports both to parquet and csv formats including today’s date in the name.

export_to_csv(df, file_name)¶

Exports a dataframe to a parquet format. :param df: The dataframe to be exported :param file_name: the name of the file to be exported

export_to_parquet(df, file_name)¶

Exports a dataframe to a parquet format. :param df: The dataframe to be exported :param file_name: the name of the file to be exported

Returns

MercyCorp utils shapefiles¶

The aim of this module is to list functions related to shapefiles.

Created on Thu Jun 19 11:14:40 2020

@author: ioanna.papachristou@accenture.com

class my_package.utils_shapefiles.Shapefiles(INPUT_PATH, OUTPUT_PATH, hierarchy)¶

Functions related to shapefiles.

create_sub_tables(shp_list)¶

Creates sub-tables per hierarchy to be used for the final location table. :param shp_list: A list of shapefiles :return: A geodataframe of all location data for the selected hierarchy

import_shapefile(country)¶

Imports a shp with the boundaries. :param country: the referring country of the shp. Choose between: “_KEN_”, “_ETH_”, “_SOM_” or “_UGA_” :param hierarchy: 0 for the country level, 1-3 for the rest of regional levels :return: A shapefile

shapefiles_list()¶

Creates a list of shapefiles according to hierarchy. :return: A list of geodataframes for all three countries (KEN, ETH, SOM) per hierarchy.
